text:
To reproduce:

$ echo '<project><echo>${message}</echo></project>' > build.xml && echo message='Please "don'"'"'t kill" me' && ant -Dmessage='Please "don'"'"'t kill" me' 
message=Please "don't kill" me
/usr/local/bin/ant: 1: eval: Syntax error: Unterminated quoted string

The following line is bogus:

  ant_exec_args="$ant_exec_args \"$arg\""

[1] suggests that printf %q might work to solve this class of problem, but it is Bash-specific (so it will not work e.g. on Ubuntu's /bin/sh).

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6071681/store-shell-arguments-in-file-while-preserving-quoting
creator: jglick@apache.org
